com.lukeleber.scandroid.gui.bluetooth

Class DeviceWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lukeleber.scandroid.gui.bluetooth.DeviceWrapper

  • public class DeviceWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
    A "pretty" wrapper around a BluetoothDevice that overrides Object.toString() in order to provide a more user-friendly representation of said device.

    The string has the form of "DEVICE_NAME (DEVICE_ADDRESS)", so for example: "OBDII (01:23:45:67:89::00)".

      • toString

        public final java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string containing a concise, human-readable description of this object. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide an implementation that takes into account the object's type and data. The default implementation is equivalent to the following expression: 
           getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())

        See Writing a useful toString method if you intend implementing your own toString method.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a printable representation of this object.
